Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: PRGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I was recently at this hotel with a large number of work colleagues. The hotel was welcoming, the service was good and the rooms comfortable. The wifi was free (and worked). Breakfast was the typical hotel buffet with a wide range of hot and cold choices. It is in a good location close the Ku'dam which has plenty of shops. There are also a range of restaurants nearby to choose from if you do not want to eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elajam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night break at the Steigenberger Berlin We stayed in one of the executive rooms with access to the Executive lounge which was well worth the extra. The rooms are large we had extra bed in for our 4 year old daughter and there was still plenty of room. The staff were fantastic and nothing was too much bother for them in particular Isabella who was working in the Executive lounge on Monday and Tuesday she was so friendly and my daughter Aimee really took to her. The front desk staff were always on hand to give us directions or tips on where to go. The hotel is really central to everything and a short walk from train station. First time in Berlin but won't be our last and we will definitely be staying at the Steigenberger when we return.

Reviews.Title: “The road to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Janis F
Reviews.Content: Decided to have a couple of days in Berlin having lived there many years ago and chose this Hotel because of it's location close to the Ku-damm. A very impressive Hotel with exellent customer service and facilities. Had a small problem with car parking when we arrived but found that the staff could not be more helpful and I would like to take this opportunity to thank the front Office Manager for his assistance. We decided to go for the Executive Lounge option and found this to be great value. Included with breakfast, we also had use of the Executive Lounge where afternoon tea, nibbles with wine, beer and soft drinks in the evening were served. Drinks in the public bar were a bit pricy so the Executive Lounge was great value, The room was clean and very well appointed with tea and coffee making facilities available. Prices in the mini bar were not too bad either but again the option of the Executive Lounge meant that we didn't need to use the bar. For people who might be concerned that a 5*hotel may be pretentious and a bit full of them selves don't worry the Steigenberger is a class hotel that makes all their guests feel welcome. All in all we both enjoyed our visit to the Steigenberger and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Pinak M
Reviews.Content: The instructions to reach from Airport were accurate. The reception during check-in was also warm and quick. Since, it was a Business we did not take in house Breakfast which according to us was expensive for a vegetarian breakfast. There were couple of Indian restaurants nearby so it was very good. The Hotel is very centrally located and very peaceful surroundings. The staff was very cordial and nice in replenishing the in room tea and coffee. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin - Los Angeles Platz - Steigenberger hotel”
Reviews.Author: KONSTANTINOS M
Reviews.Content: Very near the Zoologischer Garten station, Los Angeles Platz stays untouched in time - a miracle for Berlin. The Steigenberger hotel, is a very much decent hotel with all its exteriors kept as it was before (before the 2nd War maybe) and very much modernixed inside. The latter is not my preferance but it is today a fact that every 5 years maybe all hotels need to change from something to everything. The renovated rooms are nicely designed (more rooms are now available since the old big rooms are mostlt cut and made more sellable spaces. The problem you see immediately is that the shower place fails to evacuate utilized water and overflowing in the bathroom adn the room may happen. The breakfast is absolutely perfect in its abundance of things to eat. In this hotel, the greatest option is to have a room overlooking the los Angeles Platz and the old building array on the other side of the hotel. For dinner, years ago I had a great one at the Bacco restaurant just around the corner on Marburger Strasse. This time I chose to go to Savigny Platz....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BBmyself
Reviews.Content: I travel to Berlin frequently on business, and have stayed at this hotel multiple times. Clean and comfortable - nice lounge area for relaxing after a long day. Great location to venture out and explore, lots of restaurants nearby, and easy to get anywhere in the city conveniently via the extensive transit system.

Reviews.Title: “"decent service, comfy rooms and good location"”
Reviews.Author: OH1987
Reviews.Content: a very short walk to the kurfurstendamm U-bahn stop and a 10 minute walk from Berlin Zoo S-bahn stop from which the train from Schonefield airport stops at. The rooms are very spacious and as the hotel is situated in a quiet square it adds to an uninterrupted rest, a rare occurrence in a bustling capital. We made use of the sauna and swimming pool which is available to all residence of the hotel. reception staff were very helpful. couple of negatives, two single duvets on our double bed and no hair dryer or iron in the rooms something any 5* should have available. all in all i would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, spacious rooms, nice breakfast, recommended”
Reviews.Author: stevebil1983
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a weekend getaway for 3 nights in Berlin. + Good hotel + Spacious big rooms and WC + Centrally located, close to busses, U/S Bahn, restaurants and big shopping malls (Karstadt and KaDeWe etc) + Nice breakfast with alot of alternatives to choose + Friendly and helpful staff + Easy check in/out, they stored our luggage when we arrived earlier and also when we checked out and had some free time in the city + Clean rooms + We slept really nice, nobody disturbed us - Expensive - Lack of still water (they charge for it, it should have been free since you pay already too much for the hotel) - Wi Fi connection in 4th floor wasn't so strong so we had issues all the time - Heavy smell of cigars in the lobby since they have a cigar shop In general, everything was nice and it was a good experience, we chose a non-smoking room with a view in the square, which was quite ok. Tip: There is a supermarket "Netto" abit down in the street if needed We would choose this hotel again if we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location but 5 star??”
Reviews.Author: perge
Reviews.Content: We were group of 4 and stayed at Steigenberger for 3 nights during ITB. Overall we did not have any complains and were happy with our stay. Front office staff is efficient both during check in and check out. Location is ideal. Very close to kudamm but still on a quiet point. Rooms and bathrooms are rather small but comfortable. Dont let the ancient looking room doors and key card systems scare you, rooms are recently renovated. Although I prefer a more plain style in a hotel room rather then the colourful and stripeful carpets, furniture and curtains, it still looks good. Thin glass bathroom door could cause issues for some :)) Now on the down side. The Steigenberger did not made us feel that we were staying in a five star hotel. Nowadays the reason why 4 star chain hotels like courtyard, four points, garden inn and park inn's are so successful is because they offer everything that one would need from a good hotel. Yes they dont provide anything further than that, but does one really need it? There are still people who pay the extra and prefer to stay at 5 stars to get that extra service. Ths is where steigenberger failed imo. If we talk about in room amenities. No bathrobes, not even slippers, no shoe polish only a paper thin cleaner?? (only in executive rooms) I travel for business a lot and I dont recall a 5 star not offering these basics for qutte a while now. International 5 star chains are trying to find further amenities and conveniences in rooms to differ their selves from the 4 stars. Today everyone has good beddings, minibar, flat screen etc. And more importantly, we only had one evening turn down service out of 3 evenings. And during the regular day cleaning, they did not even fold our pj's and just left them as they were. Again, these are the small touches where five star hotels need to show that they are five stars. Although what I mentioned above is done even on a 3 star. As a guest I dont care if it is a busy period or not, I want to get the service that is required frm a 5 star. All in all, we had a good stay but when I go back to berlin, and if I am paying and not my company, I would only consider steigenberger if they have a very very good offer.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be more happy”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravelagent
Reviews.Content: I visited the ITB Trade fair from 7 untill the 9th of March 2012 and chose this hotel after reading reviews and see the excellent location near the Gedächtniskirche, Kurfürstendamm and Europa Center (Irish Pub!) Everything i have read was true. Staff helpful, excellent breakfast, large rooms, nice bathroom, free wifi in your room. Public transportation is within short walking distance - U-bahn Ku'damm and Zoo Station. I had to print my boarding pass for the flight back home, and you could simply use the computer, plug in your usb stick with the PDF, print it, and it's all for free. When i checked out, i gave them a heartfelt "untill next year".

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: Located just outside the tourist hub of Berlin but still proximate to everything, the Steigenberger offers a five star stay without the five star prices. Bottom line is the service was excellent and the rooms wonderfully comfortable. The sleek modern decor of the rooms is still comfortable and welcoming. The only downside to the place was the bar, which looked as if it hadn't been renovated since the early Reagan years. But you didn't come to Berlin to hang out in a hotel bar, did you? As a side note, there's a wonderful cigar shop with its own lounge just off the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a young family's city trip”
Reviews.Author: Sinag
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin in early 2011. Location is great to explore different sites of Berlin with a toddler. Short walk to Berlin Zoo and the bus terminal. Good connection to Potsdamer Platz for Legoland :0), Checkpoint Charlie... and for day trips to Sans Souci. Very friendly staff with good advice on restaurants and places to visit. Yummy breakfast. Tip: there is one public bus line that pretty much passes through all the key sites in Berlin. Good way to travel on a shoestring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Deutsche Bahn traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in fast, professional, friendly. Room was clean....a little tight as we had an extra bed for our 10 year old. First bottle (o,5lt.) water was complementary (sign was missing) which is not common in Germany. Pool was small but very relaxing as water was lovely and warm 28°C ! However, shower in the changing room was unisex with no seperation....not good. Location excellent...close to Kudamm (main strip for shopping) and to the tube station. Breakfast..great selection..fresh...except for food under the warm light (sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs) was luke warm. Definitely worth returnung to.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: shachaf K
Reviews.Content: i spent four days at the Steigenberger hotel with my girlfriend during January . besides the pleasant guy at the door,we got checked in by a very nice and informative reception staff.i could see from the first moment the the service is Steigenberger's highest value. It is located on one of the most centraled streets in Berlin.where u can find large selection of restaurants ,cafes , and other shopping attractions. the rooms were clean and well organized,the only problem was the TV. there weren't any English speaker's channels ,not even one. the breakfast there is wonderful and can turn to everyone no matter what kind of fool they like at morning time.a very calm and elegant bar.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: elpidoushka
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice stay. The executive room was very comfortable and the access to the executive lounge very convinient. Room was clean and everything in perfect condition. There was an issue with the magnetic keys for both room and lounge and i had to change them several times... sometimes it was a bit annoying...

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Henry R
Reviews.Content: Our long weekend here was just perfect. This hotel is excellent! It is located right on the spot and there are some many things to do and to see in Berlin. I truly recommend taking the 3 day ticket for public transportation; it is so convenient and cheap comparing taking a cab when you need. I guess we spend most of the time outside doing all the touristy stuff you need to do in Berlin. The hotel itself has a lot to offer. The rooms are really, really nice. They have nice décor, and the functionality is great (you got everything you need basically). And if not, the personnel fix it for you in no time. They are so nice and friendly, that it makes you feel like home. The breakfast is completing the package, it is definitely good. I will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: ElhamValleyMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to Berlin so in an effort to use up our British Airways Air Miles before they expired we booked a flight and got a great package from the hotel direct rather than via a discount site. A 5 star hotel in the centre of Berlin for 3 nights for about 300 euros is great value in anyone's money. Exactly what you would expect from a German 5 star hotel. Everything was excellent. We would definitely return both to Berlin and this hotel. An excellent weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cjwlutton
Reviews.Content: booked just before Christmas for travel on the 8th January, so got a good rate. The hotel staff were very helpful, breakfast excellent. Easy to catch bus or train to all the museums and airport; we got a 72hr transport ticket, very good value. Lots of interesting restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alexander W
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay for business , leisure and/or shopping. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: torpedo-dude
Reviews.Content: PROS-Got a deal on this. 5 Star hotel at a discount price. Amazing Deal! Outstanding overall experience. Service was top-notch. Fabulous bathroom and extraordinary comfort. They even brought night snack one evening. We used the espresso maker every night too! Relaxing indoor pool and sauna and Spa options to die for. It's right near multiple S/U stops and near lots of attractions. If the price is right for you, there is no better place to stay. CONS-Breakfast too expensive for a family of four but I'm sure it is awesome. Mechanical issues with turn-style front entrance locked us in the middle for a couple of minutes before the front desk came and rescued us.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: amnon t
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling for more than thirty years. This is one of the best hotels I've been ever. An amazing breakfast. Great service. excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well situated”
Reviews.Author: patriknimmerstam
Reviews.Content: Just a short bit from Kurfürstendamm and Bahnhof Zoo at a peaceful locaktion. Nice rooms and beds very comfortable. The only bad thing was that all nosies from the corridor could be heard in the room, even though you could hear nothing from the rooms next to you. When you room was close to the spa-area, that meant a lot of noise from the corridor when lots of people were passing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ysolde
Reviews.Content: To start with the obvious, this is not quite a five-star hotel. It simply lacks the elegance, the small small details, of those really exceptional hotels that are few and far between. That said, the Steigenberger is an amazing place. It is located on Los Angeles Platz, just off the fashionable Ku'damm (Berlin's version of the Champs Elysees). Incredible shops, restaurants, boutiques, and cafes are just steps away. The view from our room was to Los Angeles Platz itself, and it was a lovely way to wake up each morning. Our room, on the sixth floor, was large enough and quite comfortable, and included a bathroom with two sinks, something every couple could use. The Steigenberger really distinguishes itself with excellent, excellent service. When I had a bad head cold and was feeling worn out, an extra comforter and even a space heater were quickly found for me (on Christmas!). Meals at the hotel restaurant were delicious and served by a delightful staff that seemed truly happy to be there. Housekeeping was prompt and helpful every time we called them. The front desk was available, friendly, and incredibly helpful day and night. This is how you run a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good and well locate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Agos2011
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel for a family Berlin holiday. The two rooms were quite confortable and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Good styled hotel in a good position a few blocks from KaDeWe meant that the metro and an abundance of great restaurants were minutes away. Buffet Breakfast was really good (german style).

Reviews.Title: “All under one roof Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KoningBokko
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with good service and professional people who love what they do. Compliments to that massage therapist. The pool is a bit small and childish. There two nice bars and a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked!”
Reviews.Author: Kate-go-round
Reviews.Content: I was planning to go to Berlin for a very long time, and finaly planned to go for a weekend 2 months in advance. From the beginning I knew I wanted to stay in grat germain chain Steigenberger. But I was very surpriced to discover that they had an overbook!!! I know that it happens all the time, but I have never thought that it will happen with me, when I have booked the room so much in advance. Thank God, they have called to Intercontinental and they had some rooms, so we moved to Intercont. After all I was glad I have stayed in Intercont, as I really enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for first timers in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: hippyhappytraveller
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Steigenberger Berlin and would recommend it to anyone travelling to Berlin for the first time. The hotel location is perfect and is situated in a relatively quiet street just off the heart of the shopping district, the Ku'Damm. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional, especially Mr Lendt, who helped us with most our our quieries. The room was very comfortable, clean and modern and the spa facilities were great after a hectic day of sightseeing! The buffet breakfast was fantastic, lots of choices, so there was no need for a big lunch. It proved to be great value for money, especially for 4 days, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location and perfect service”
Reviews.Author: mary0128
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin on a business trip and chose this hotel because it has a perfect location. Shops of the Ku-damm are just close by and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The hotel has a nice lobby and neat rooms, very warm and comfortable. I really liked the fresh rose in the bathroom which gave it a special touch. The breakfast is great. The breakfast area was crowded one morning and we were seated in an additional room. Although we were the only ones there, there was always someone taking care of us, even though it was a busy time. The staff at the front desk was also very nice and helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay close to the Ku Damm in the heart of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dumbo77
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the staff couldn't do enough for you and the rooms were lovely (I had booked an executive twin). The hotel location was perfect for shopping, browsing the Christmas Markets and sightseeing tours. On arrival we were offered the opportunity to upgrade to the executive lounge, costing €30 each per night. This proved to be great value for money as this included breakfast, unlimited tea/coffee or soft drinks, afternoon tea and a small buffet with wine or beers in the evening. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and was sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_nl
Reviews.Content: The location near the Kudamm makes it perfect for tourist things like the KaDeWe etc. Last time I visited this hotel was 10 years ago but in my memory this was a very good stay. That is why I choose this hotel over my favorit (Mandala, Potsdamerstrasse) also because it is relatively close to the ICC. Rooms are recently renovated, very clean, comfortable enough but somewhat small (I traveled solo on this occasion but id I would have been with wife and kids the standard room would have been too small). Service all over the place is very good. Choice of wines and cognacs in the hotel Pianobar is limited. The pool and spa area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance!”
Reviews.Author: VSKrishnan
Reviews.Content: The Steigenberger, Berlin where we spent 4 nights over 5th to 8th Aug, is like a well preserved ‘jewel’ hidden away just a block away from the bustling Ku’Damm in a quiet garden area! Apart from its excellent location right next door to the Ku’Damm & the vast selection of restaurants and stores, the Executive Floor we were upgraded to had rooms classy in looks and fittings and a dream of a bed going with it! The view into the leafy garden next door was pleasing on the eye. While strict efficiency was very much on display in the hotel lobby, housekeeping etc, the hotel management might want to encourage their Reception Staff to sport a smile or two while welcoming guests! It only adds to your ‘Class’.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, just not quite GREAT. Your grandmother's hotel choice, maybe”
Reviews.Author: jimwentzell
Reviews.Content: I took my wife, son and an aunt for a nice weekend in Berlin in January '10.....the two rooms we booked shared a nice private entry. Although rather small they were tastefully furnished, with very comfortable bedding and of course immaculate overall. The location, on quiet Los Angelesplatz within walking distance of the Zoo station, can't be beat....Ku'damm and Kaufhaus Des Westens department store (KaDeWe) are within a few hundred meters. We were very impressed with how quickly the city workers cleared the streets after a major snowstorm/near blizzard (,,Daisy'') and the hotel staff kept the icy-wet doormat from becoming a mess. Staff is very helpful, yet the piano bar downstairs was nearly empty, and seemed a bit dated-looking. The giftshop and restaurant were forgettable, and the atmosphere overall seemed just a bit stuffy and dated, like it had seen better days. After staying at the newer Steigenberger in Dresden I came to expect exemplary service for the five-star hotel chain. The Berlin Steigenberger seemed just a bit shy of exemplary but adequate nonetheless. After two days we moved to the nearly-new Mercure Hotel Checkpoint Charlie.....Berlin-Mitte seems so much more alive!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uchy0
Reviews.Content: I go often in Berlin for my work, and always I stay in this hotel.. Is really a very good hotel, the rooms are nice, the personal is kind. Also the breakfast in very good. I do not have any complain about this hotel. Sincerely I strong reccomand it. The position is not bad, around 10 minutes taxi from Tegel and close to metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: CAOLILAWELL
Reviews.Content: My wife treated me to another stay in this lovely hotel for my 50th birthday , just a little back from the busy shopping streets of Berlin , we traveled from Glasgow , then via train to the bahnhof zoo station, then walked a very short distance to the hotel , very easy & without pain . We booked via an online firm & got a very good rate , we ate breakfast on the two morning & paid 92 euro ... ( excellent with a great choice & if you like a little sparkle in the morning available was trocken (a type of cava) ) decore throughout the hotel is sheek & stylish . very busy at times the piona bar has a guy playing later at night ... nice , prices at the cocktail bar well ... 5* (glass of red wine & a camapri soda 20euro ... ouch ! , the other bar was a little less steep . we ate out italian on our first night (plenty of choice around this area , dinner in all sorts of and were not dissapointed, we ate in the hotel the second night 2 courses and a decent bottle of chilean merlot 70 euro, nice german fair rooms were of a very high standard ( I think recently refurbished) & mini-bar fully stocked with full tea & coffee facilities also on hand the staff were all very friendly & all speaking english A very enjoyable stay ... downside ... stung at the cocktail bar .... well it is a 5star !

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: revitalise
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Steigenberger Hotel for 3 nights in late August 2011. I knew that I wanted to be in West Berlin and adjacent to good public transport. In this respect the hotel is excellent; a shortish walk from the airport-city centre bus stop at Bahnhof Zoo and convenient too for the Underground. The hotel location is also fairly quiet, with no major thoroughfare close by. Accommodation was excellent, the room having evidently been recently refurbished. It was not especially large but perfectly adequate. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom did not have a bathtub but the shower was powerful and very acceptable. The buffet breakfast was splendid, one of the best I've seen. The restaurant in which it is served is light and airy. Staff throughout the hotel were extremely friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “solid hotel, great location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: arnsch
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in walking distance from Zoo train station - even with a bit of baggage. The trip from the airport by public transport was very easy. The location is right next to the main shopping area, but very quite at the same time. Breakfast was very good, though hotel-price expensive. The pool is a bit small. Almost the size of a big jacuzzi. Would come back. Nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rbc_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 5th floor - the executive floor - and really enjoyed the free use of the lounge (free soft drinks, coffee and tea, wine, cakes, snacks and small sandwiches - absolutely delightful!). Very much worth the extra payment for the room, which was not huge but extremely comfy. I don't know how are the rooms on the lower floors but I strongly recommend taking an executive room. The front desk staff is very helpful and friendly, they gave us some excellent recommendations. The pool is an added bonus - very small but nice for a quick dip after a long day or early in the morning. The location of the hotel is great, close to public transportation, walking distance from the park and the zoo, many restaurants and stores in the near neighborhood. All in all, we had a great time in Berlin and will definitely be back - to the city and to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing less than brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: etroyoslo
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Steigenberger recidence. The first was at the Steigenberger Airport Hotel in Frankfurt, where I spent one night, due to my clumpsy and awkward fail of booking a return ticket online one month later than the day I was to return ... Needless to say, I was stressed out big time because of this, and because the flight I had ment to book a ticket for was the red eye flight I had to wait til the next day for my new flight. This led me to booking my first stay at a Steigenberger. When arriving at this hotel I met an extremely friendly and professional member og the staff, who provided me with a great Executive room and helped me out with everything when I booked my new flight, from helping me finding the cheapest flight, to printing my new documents and so on, I was truly impressed and greatful for all this help. Thank you! The experience descriced above then led me to book an Exceutive room at a Steigenberger hotel, when me and my friends went to Berlin for a music festival from nov.4 - nov 7. For this trip, two of us, were straying at his hotel and the third one had arranged to stay with at a friends private residence We all arrived in Berlin with an early plane at 9 am, and decided to drop of our luggage at the Steigenbergen for storage and to check in later. When arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by very friendly staff from the very start, providing us with maps over the local area and recomendatins for things to do, while waiting for our room to be ready for check-in. It is important to take note that at that point there where was also a significant number of other guests checking in and out in the lobby area. However, just minutes after having provided us with maps, strored our luggage etc. Our incredibly friendly and professonial host at the counter Mr. Marcel Dost, had arranged for us to be able to check in within the hour. The three of us, then decided to wait in the Piano Bar, after just 40 mintes Mr.Dost, personally delivered our keycards to us in the Piano Bar, and arranged for our luggage to be delievered to our room, when we were to leave the Bar. The third one of us who was originally going to stay at a friends place, was so impressed by this amazing service and welcoming that he decided to book a room for one night. We could mention loads of other details describing this fantastic level of service, but need only say that during the rest of the stay, were provided with the same warmth, professional and friendly service from all members of staff. Not to forget the fantastic treatment we were given by the ever so nice staff at the charming spa/pool/sauna, perfect place to detox after a long night out. I highly recommend this hotel, it's a perfect place to stay! Thank you all, we will be back! Very special thanks to Mr. Marcel Dost. Best regards, peace, Edvard Troy Bruheim

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: nashepa
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very friendly staff, excellent location: only a couple of minutes walking from underground, easy acces to shops , restaurant and bus tours of the city. Ask the concierge for some restaurants recommendations, they gave us some excellent tips on local places!!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joasia
Reviews.Content: IT IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL. There is a lot to like, but – overall I would not stay here again. I admire their bending over backwards, service wise, they really try hard to please. But… They have lower floors (3rd thru 4th) are of 4 star quality, then “executive 5th floor” - 4.5 stars at the most. 6th floor is supposedly better than 5th – haven’t been there. Guide books say Berlin is a relatively inexpensive capital where 5 star hotels can be had for $150/nt. We had a reservation for a quiet room for 9 nights (light sleepers) @ a supposedly great pre-paid price thru DHR of $175 for a double. What we got was a tiny room on the 3rd floor right next to the elevator, thus a very noisy environment with a small bathroom with shower only. We requested to be moved to a quiet room – the only one available was on the 5th floor (at $28 premium per nt.). This room was a little bigger, bathroom very nice, 2 sinks, with only a bathtub, super slippery for shower taking. The toilet flush was a stupid button in the wall – so difficult to push that I had to use both thumbs and still often couldn’t do it. We like separate beds, so we had the two twins separated – these were the smallest, shortest beds I’ve seen. With tiny but very thick comforters, hotter than hell, no sheets, no blankets. When I asked the front desk for blankets they sent sheets. Had to look up the word in the dictionary – decke – this time it worked. So – falling off the bed every time I rolled over and losing my tiny covers – we did not sleep at all. Their breakfast is top shelf, never had better, but the crowds! Well, they must be popular. My other big complaint – they do not have a concierge. AND they don’t have a rack with tour company brochures downstairs like all the hotels I’ve been to – so if you have not done your homework for sightseeing, good luck. They SAY they have a concierge, but that person does not have a separate desk. You are supposed to ask the front desk all the questions and they ALL claim to be concierge. All the answers I got from them (after standing in a line with check in/out crowd) were wrong. Like about Reichstag viewing reservations – they said apply 1 day prior, website said – 2 days. I once asked in the morning what the weather forecast was for the next day (making plans) and the lady said “I think tomorrow is going to be like today”. I THINK? You are in front of a computer, go online and check it for me, I am not really asking what you think. So – in conclusion – I feel duped. It is not a 5 star hotel, but they sure charge you for it. And – as far as the location – the area around Gandarmen Markt, with the elegant stores, cafes, museums, is a lot nicer. Ku’dam is full of all kinds of crowds that you might not appreciate being around, some being tattooed skinheads panhandling, with a dog in tow. Definitely would try East Berlin the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location only”
Reviews.Author: WarsawExplorer
Reviews.Content: Hotel like hundred others you visited before ... but good location when you visit Berlin for 1-3 nights. Very good breakfast, clean rooms, average service. I enjoyed staying there while paying corporate rate. Regular price is above 160 Eur. No fun, no atmosphere - just proper hotel for short time accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but busy - breakfast a bit of a scrum”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was generally good. The restaurant catered very well for special dietary needs with unruffled calm and the hotel is well located close to transport, the Kufurstendamm and Karstadt department store. The biggest drawback was the breakfast buffet which was bit of a scrum - no-one helped you find a table and the speed of clearing vacated tables was often slow. We needed large tumblers of water for tablet taking and this seemed nearly impossible with small wine glasses being all that was offered. All in all a good comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere and location”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztof F F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the KaDeWe, it looks promising. The buffe breakfast at Hotelet had everything what I needed plus much more. The coffee should be better. Dinner at Hotelet restaurant was a disappointment. It is OK that the food can be a particular day not on the top but to serve mushroom soup without the soup was in the vicinity of mushrooms is unacceptable. Very good service at restaurant and I mean it, and it is not because we were not charged for the "mushroom soup". My room was very nice but the bed was harder than hard. Why I allways return to Steingenberger Hotel at Los Angeles Platz in Berlin? First of all the atmosphere around hotel and the location. Next visit, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: docscooter
Reviews.Content: We had three nights here during the Berlin marathon weekend and it provided a great base to stay. The hotels location was great for shopping and seeing the sights. It was an easy walk from Zoo underground and main train station which get you to the sights or an easy express train the the airport. The check in was very good, friendly efficient staff The room was modern, well presented, spacious and very clean. There was a good sized comfortable bed, flat TV, tea making, water and mini bar. The bathroom had a large shower but no bath. We used room service for breakfast one day and the quality of the food was excellent and it arrived exactly on time. We used the pool and sauna which were good. Reception service with changing rooms, towels, bathrobes. Items which could be improved by the hotel Breakfast,as others have mentioned, is very expensive at €23. Does the hotel really think recreational weekend break couples, as we were, are going to spend €138 on breakfasts? We constantly had to keep asking for tea and coffee that the cleaners failed to refill each day which would then be delivered to the room by very annoyed and grumpy staff.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Quality”
Reviews.Author: meetjoeblack
Reviews.Content: Either you travel for business or as a couple Steigenberger would be a good choice in Berlin. Its located in Ku'damm and 5 minutes to the metro station. The front desk is friendly but the hotel lacks a concierge. A good concierge would have been more helpfull in a city like Berlin. The rooms are really nicely decorated and spacious. You should visit the pool area with all the sauna facilities. Its really peacefull. Not impressed with the room service menu. If you are a business travel who gets hungry after 11:00AM you only have two choice of things to order. Generally nice choice. I would definetly stay there again. But if you want to be in the histrocial and touristic center you should choose another district then modern shooping district of Ku'damm

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: smooms
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Steigenberger Berlin. I have to say that I was impressed overall by the experience . There were a couple of teething problems on arrival. Firstly the door between our room and the neighbouring one was not locked, and the safe was not working. A call to the desk was met with a prompt and efficient response, despite it being after 8pm at night both were resolved without delay. One cannot expect perfection every time but I always believe true customer service can only be judged by the response given when problems do arise. I cannot fault the Steigenberger staff at all here. The rooms were spacious, modern and clean, the beds comfortable. Sadly we were too busy to visit the pool and spa so cannot pass comment there. We had a great time , the hotel is ideally placed, just a 5 minute walk from the Zoologischer Garten U bahn and train station from which you can travel directly to the airport on the airport express. ( 3 euros one way ) It is just outside the main hustle and bustle but with such a great transport network this is not an issue. Would highly recommend this hotel, and we plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Delivers as promised! Excellent value in a terrific location.”
Reviews.Author: CatskillMountainMan
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 rooms (3 Executive Rooms plus 1 Suite) and we were very satisfied with our stay for all three nights. I might designate this as a 4.5-star property rather than a 5-star property as I feel strongly that only the most exceptional of hotels qualify for 5-star rating. That said, this hotel was an excellent choice for us. It is a well managed and well maintained property. I chose this property over the Kempinski Hotel Bristol and had no regrets. Service from the staff at the front desk and in the Executive Lounge was excellent. Staff were always friendly, helpful and courteous. We had a very minor hiccup with the check-in process: we were not given our access keys to the Executive Lounge right at check-in but a staff member delivered those keys shortly afterwards to our party after their discovery of the oversight. In my room, there was no bar soap at the sink the first night--a minor oversight which was corrected the following day. Rooms were very attractive and well cleaned. One exception was a stain present on the cushion of my desk chair, but I suppose they had done the best they could to eliminate the stain at the time with little success. Housekeeping was otherwise efficient and friendly when encountered. Nightly turn-down service was appreciated. I loved waking up in the morning and having the view over Los Angeles Platz. Room was very quiet and had ample space. Bed was very comfortable--not quite the comfort of a Starwood Hotel Group bed, but very good. WiFi connection in my room was very weak, which was surprising considering I was in the center of the building not too far from the elevator. My party greatly appreciated the included free internet access. Food offerings in the Executive Lounge were very good. It is well worth the extra fee if one considers that breakfast alone downstairs would otherwise have cost EUR 23 per person. Breakfast was, however, repetitive every day in the Lounge but the selection of offerings was diverse enough and the quality was very good. I sampled tea-time offering on one day and hors d'oevres on another day and was pleased both times. I never made use of the spa. One member of my party wanted to swim, but the swimming pool was too small (10 m diameter circular pool) for any serious exercise. There is no other exercise equipment that I was aware of on the premises, however I was told that a day pass to a local fitness facility could be purchased. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to anyone. We enjoyed the Charlottenburg location off the Ku'damm, even though Mitte is where most of our daily activity occurred. It was an excellent value for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Czechgolfer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights there. The hotel is well maintained and equipped. The staff is helpful and very professional. Rooms are relatively spacious and spotlessly clean (as you would expect anywhere in Germany). The hotel is ideally located for shopping lovers – the main shopping street is five minutes walking. The main tourist attractions are accessible by tube or by taxi for costs of approximately EUR 10. A huge breakfast can be delivered to your room for additional fees of EUR 5, which is an option I would definitely recommend. My only adverse comment relates to the hotel restaurant which is rather expensive and the food served is pretty average. Underground parking is also available for EUR 19 per day. In nutshell. This is a good hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: afursten
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with 2 friends. The rooms are nice and the location of course very central to former West Berlin. The staff at the reception desk was very friendly and helpful. The only "negative" points would be: absence of pressure in the shower and price of breakfast if you want to include it (23 euros, but there are plenty of places around where you can get good and cheaper breakfast). Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julia E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two teenage sons in August 2011. The hotel itself was great. The room was large and clean, plenty of room for the three of us. Beds very comfortable. Air-con excellent and not at all noisy. Reception staff courteous but not overly friendly or helpful. Found them slightly intimidating even though I do speak German! The cost of Breakfast was extortionate at 23 euros each. We ate out locally and huge breakfasts were between 5 and 8 euros. Nothing could justify 23 euros for breakfast. The bars were great, with air-conditioned interious and comfortable outdoor areas. Again rather pricey compared to local bars - 8 euros for a glass of wine and 10 euros of half a glass of fizz. Coke was 8 euros too, which I thought was rather steep. Nice cocktails though and these were OK at (you guessed it) 8 euros! The location of the hotel was great - easy to get to from the train station, close to shops, bars and restuarants. I recommend this hotel based on the location and comfort level.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MISSAdventurers
Reviews.Content: We paid a good price for four nights' stay with breakfast. The location of the hotel is perfect and the rooms are nicely furnished, with very comfortable beds. The bathroom was of a good size, but the quality of the towels could have been better. Breakfast was superb, although it could be difficult to get a table some mornings. The staff were overall very polite and helpful. The pool was quite small, but perfectly adequate to relax in after a day walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Malsorman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five day stay - the perfect location to see and explore Berlin - we had a great time thanks largely to the staff at the reception desk, they couldn`t have been more helpful, giving good advice and which buses to use, nothing was too much trouble for them! We had a very comfortable room overlooking the square and the choice for breakfast was simply amazing, well worth paying the price for service and comfort! Would have been nice to have dressing gowns provided, instead of turning down the beds in the evening and laying towels on the floor each side of the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: saraWiltshire
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews we approached the check-in desk with some trepidation. However, we were greeted with warmth and enthusiasm by one of the desk staff (impeccable English of course!) Our room was ready for us which was most unexpected as it was only 11am. We were issued with a map and given lots of useful advice on what to see etc. Our room door was sticky and difficult to open and a member of staff dealt with this really promptly and courteously. Robes for the spa were dispensed immediately to our rooms. I cannot praise the staff more highly in fact. The hotel is in a really convenient location - less than 10 minutes walk from the zoo which was where the airport bus terminated (2 euros 30 - what a bargain and very quick too!) The station at the zoo provides links to both the underground and the overground railways and the whole of the Berlin transport network is clean, efficient and cheap. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but used the local cafes which were excellent value and very good indeed. There are many good restaurants in the locality too as well as superb shops. If I have any criticism at all it would be that the pool, although lovely and with a very relaxing environment, is a little small. With more than 3 people in it is crowded. We had to pick our times to use it but it was popular most of the time. We had a fantastic time in Berlin - everything worked well (except for the weather on the first day!!). We would definitely return to this hotel - it was extremely clean, quiet, well located, with very comfortable beds and helpful and friendly staff - what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravellerGuy
Reviews.Content: The Steigenberger Berlin was perfect. We had 2 rooms, both of which were a good size, wonderfully appointed and looking over the pretty Los Angeles Platz. The staff were mostly friendly and helpful - in particular Mr T. Schneider who was always ready to help out. The chamber maids kept the rooms to an impeccable standard and were always smiling and friendly. The location was perfect (60 seconds away from the KuDamm - the Oxford Street of Berlin) and some lovely restaurants, and as many seconds away from a U-Bahn station for trips further afield. There is also a taxi rank outside the hotel. A taxi to/from Tegel Airport will cost you around €20, or there is a bus stop nearby which is just €2.30 each way. The swimming pool wasn't huge but was never too busy and always a pleasure to visit. I ventured upstairs for breakfast one morning which looked amazing, but at €23, slightly on the pricey side. The Piano Bar was lovely and I enjoyed sitting in there with a book and a coffee or talking over a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: TiggiNorway
Reviews.Content: There is only one word for this hotel: Perfect. Try to get the breakfast included (I did). If not avoid it. Too expensive. Did not use spa/swimmingpool.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: philbert415
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely good. However, I was a bit disappointed in the size of the room - rather small - however, it was clean and very quiet. Very good room service in turning down the bed at nights and nice quality bedding except for the pillow which was quite lumpy. The breakfasts were amazing - first rate!!! Nothing spared here and such a great start to the day. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Berlin Hotel - centrally located”
Reviews.Author: NWagner55060
Reviews.Content: Fabulously appointed hotel - in terms of location (in the middle of prime shopping & restaurants area, close to Ku-Damm), good breakfast, excellent service, especially great bellman with good restaurant ideas...and to boot, a mini Beer Garden in the front! Highly recommended for tourists or business travelers - clean, quiet rooms plus internet!

Reviews.Title: “unbelievanly helpful concierge service”
Reviews.Author: h0ward1
Reviews.Content: I left my camera in a taxi. This disaster was resolved with the help of the concierge, Ralph He had already booked us three excellent places for dinner, and then trumped this by getting my camera back He telephoned the place we had dinner , because they had ordered the taxi for us. He then called the cab company and managed to get the name of the driver Finally, with some difficulty, he was able to get the mobile number of the driver and persuaded him to return the camera This was all done on his weekend off, in his own time. In life its the people that make a difference and any organisation is only as good as the people that work there. This was a nice hotel, but without doubt Ralph made it an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “8 wonderful days at the Steigenberger Berlin”
Reviews.Author: borninberlin
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 5th late in the evening with an infant and were in our room on the 4th floor within minutes. The first night we encountered problems with the shower not draining and a defective baby bed. Bringing this to their attention, Mr. Thomas Schneider at the front desk offered an upgrade on floor 6 for a small fee, including use of the lounge on floor 6. This was just perfect for us, since the lounge offers a good breakfast, afternoon tea and evening appetizers in a quiet environment. and wonderful staff . Also there are 2 computers with free internet access which was used by us every day. The hotel was one of the best we ever stayed in, from the beds to the beautiful bathrooms,and I have stayed in many hotels around the world. Shampoos, lotions, bath gel were replaced every day. The pool was great and heated. Also the service of the bell captain was outstanding. On an ongoing basis Mr. Sebastian Sonnemann at the front desk greeted us every day when we returned and made us feel welcome. All together, a wonderful stay and next time we are in Berlin, ONLY STEIGENBERGER, that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorelei3
Reviews.Content: Welcome at the hotel was good, the guys in charge of the luggage are particularly helpful and good humoured. The reception staff were friendly and efficient. We were offered a' very nice room at the front of the hotel ' by the receptionist . (This was code for a noisy room next to the lifts with an unattractive view and not at he front ! ) The room was a good size and well furnished. There were armchairs and a footstool, ideal for relaxing after sightseeing. The beds were extremely comfortable with good quality bed linen. Bathroom clean and functional but no robes provided. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided as was free wifi which were both well used and appreciated. The location is ideal for Ku'damm and the Zoo. Ku'damm is a little like Oxford Street and is very busy.There are transport links to the main sights but is not as central as other areas. We had already spent 2 nights in the Mitte area which we much preferred. We did not use the restaurant but had drinks in the piano bar one evening. Not sure how this hotel has five star status, it is very nice but I would say it is on a par with many 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in a great location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: simonlee001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights at the end of April. The hotel is in a great location on Los Angeles Platz – just a couple of minutes walk from the Ku’damm and its various attractions. Good transport links – several stations within a short distance in different directions. Check-in was completed very quickly. Superb staff on reception – always friendly to guests and helpful with information etc. I had booked a standard room and the staff managed to get me a room overlooking the square, which I appreciated - had no problems with noise from the square. Offered free wi-fi at check-in – this always worked and the speed was good. Room was modern and very well presented and furnished. Comfortable bed, large TV and a choice of different lights – all making it a very relaxing room. Bathroom was quite small, but certainly adequate and like the bedroom, it was well appointed and modern – my room was one with walk-in shower instead of a bath. Good standard of housekeeping – this was evident throughout the hotel. Swimming pool is quite small and round and it was easier to swim in circles than do lengths of just 3 or 4 strokes. I felt a bit like a goldfish!! Didn’t use the bars or restaurants, so cannot comment on them. However, they did look very nice. Would stay at the Steigenberger again without a question. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, spacious rooms, and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Broc912
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fairly easy to find. It is only about a five minute walk from the bus stop at Zoo.... Garden. Taking the bus from the airport was extremely efficient in time and cost. Anyway, the room was pretty big and quiet. The hotel is situated on a fairly quiet road. Nice bathroom and very comfy beds. Housekeeping was OK, but they never replenished the coffee, teas, or sugar that we used, and the same with the bathroom products. Plenty of storage space in the closet. Wifi was always available, though a bit of a pain to enter the log-in credentials every time I signed on. The breakfast buffet was great. Good coffee, sparkling wine was always available, and a nice selection of hot and cold foods. The staff was friendly throughout the hotel. I would recommend this hotel as it was a good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennytalkshotels
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel, polite staff who are only happy to help. Go there!

Reviews.Title: “value for money 5 star hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: r0bb029
Reviews.Content: As a party of 5 (four adults and a 14 year old), we booked this hotel through booking.com and got a very good rate. (and you can cancel for free up untilthe day of arrival). This was a surprise 40th birthday treat for one of our party. The hotel is in a superb location, in our oppinion, in the whole of Berlin. It is easy to find from the train station (Zooalogical Garten), which has an Airpot Express train running to Shonefeld Airport every 15 minutes, and is only a short 5-10 minute walk away. The hotel is also "literally" around the corner from the Kurfensdam - a fabulous long street with numerous resturantes and any shop you would find in New York. The KaDeWa (Harrods of Berlin) is also situated on this street. In addition KFC, Mc Donalds, Burger King etc and numerous stalls and small cafes offer snacks if a resturant is not required. The Hotel itself does live up to its 5 five star reputation, with the helpful, courtious staff, but we booked a standard room (the cheapest) and althouth the furnishings and bed were immaculate, and all have flet screen TV,s I did find a pair of shoes under the bed, suggesting this area had not been cleaned after the last guest left? The Tea and Coffe were not pleantiful, but you only had to ask and it would be replaced. The pool and spa were amazing, but be warned this is Europe and people tend to use the communial shower in the nude! The reception staff were helpful and informative when asked for directions etc. We would stay here again and would recomend this to others However the resturaunt and bar was extremely expensive but the tarrifs are clearly displayed. Thank you for a wonderful stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: madmax25000
Reviews.Content: Got a deal in this hotel through Alpharooms. An excellent hotel that lives up to its 5* reputation. Kicked off with the offer or free wifi at check-in before I had even asked if they had wifi ( its the small things that all add up ) No stone left unturned and its location was excellent. Loads of nice little restaurents nearby if you dont fancy eating in the hotel. Great Value to be had in Berlin at the moment and the staff in the Hotel were more than Friendly adding to an already excellent experience. They also have a great spa (even though the pool is quite small) The breakfast is fantastic too with a huge selection of meats ( both hot and cold) Overall I'm delighted I stayed here !

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: edwincheekymonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Steigenberger for 4 nights on a B&B basis with my partner. The hotel was very nice with helpful staff at the check-in counter. Our room was pretty spacious, with a (pricey) minibar, a large bed and an OK-sized TV. There were only 2 channels in English, BBC World News and CNN. Our room had a bath tub, but some rooms have only showers. The wifi connection was pretty weak because of the location of our room, but it did work. There was some traffic noise in the room, but nothing that interrupted our sleep. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was really tasty, with lots of choice (but no pancakes or porridge). There are even newspapers to read, both German and foreign ones. The staff were pretty good in the breakfast room and the experience was unhurried. I particularly liked the tea menu and the musli. I really liked the pool, even though it was small. My partner liked the sauna, but I didn't use it. We didn't use the restaurant, the pub or the piano bar. I did buy some postcards in the hotel shop, though. I thought the location of the hotel was pretty good. It's within walking distance to Ku'damm, Zoo and Augsburger str. tube stations, as well as the bus stop for the bus services 100 and 200 (very handy for tourists like us). I used a 5-day travel card, which I bought at the airport on arrival. All in all I liked the hotel very much and I would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reasonabley priced 4 star accomodation”
Reviews.Author: pdwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated a 20-30 minute taxi ride from Scoenfoeld airport (approx 35 euro). We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. (we don't believe the negative coments recorded elsewhere) Our suitcases were taken to our room whilst we checked in. Room was larger than average and was well furnished.Bed was comfortablewith choice of pillows. Hotel is in quiet location and we were able to sleep with the window open. Bathroom well appointed and very clean. Breakfast consisted of better than average hotel fare - eg freshly squuezed orange juice and fresh bread. However it was not included in the room rate and was very expensive (23 euro each). Nicely apointed spa on second floor. Very pleasant piano bar and second bar retaraunt on second floor but drinks were expensive. Hotel is conveniently located and close to some of the main tourist attractions - berlin does not have a city centre as such. Also close to the first stop for the hop on and hop off City Tours bus which is a good way to travela round the city. There are some excellent reasonably priced restaraunts and some of Berlin's biggest and best shops within easy walking distance.All in all a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sveew
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, nice decoration, very clean, quiet, modern. A bit far from the restaurant and bar areas but very close from the U-Bahn. The restaurant in the hotel is really not good. I didn't try the breakfast as the room was already quite expensive and i didn't want to charge 23 additional Euros per breakfast to my company. However it is good place to stay if your conference is at the same hotel. I would recommend it for business but not for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Why I will avoid the Steigenberger”
Reviews.Author: scherbsParis
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights with a booking agency getting a good deal. We chose it for the location.We found the service very bad, every request (like replacement coffee bags had to be made twice, which should have happened automatically but did not even when the empty ones were conspicuously left out Every evening a small mat would appear on each side of the bed, who knows why, but the window was left open in subzero temperatures! The front desk was snooty and supercilious. When our flight was canceled because of snow and I enquired at 7pm about a room., I was quoted an exorbitant price. I pointed out (in German)that they were unlikely to let the room at that time, I was told disdainfully "this is not a bazaar"! We moved to "the Circus" which was brilliant, helpful staff can do attitude. We will be back but never to the Steigenberger.......!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Just back from Berlin. Steinberger Hotel was excellent. Room top class. Booked with Alpha Rooms and got breakfast included (costs €23 each normally) all for around €100 a night. Breakfast was excellent . Good location close to numerous restaurants and one of the main shopping districts in Berlin. 10 minutes walk to Zoologicial Gardens train station , with direct line to Schonefield airport (35 minutes) and cost €3! Also direct line to all tourist spots in former East Berlin - only 15 minutes away. in Berlin, don't miss Walking Tour. Meeting point at zoological Train Station. Took 4.5 hours but was excellent and never felt the time go. Our guide Jamie was excellent. If you want to look at TV when you are here, only have CNN and BBC world News. Have Sky but no one could tell me whats on, but you don't go to Berlin to look at TV !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BHGuld
Reviews.Content: We travel often to Berlin (short stays), and always stay at the Steigenberger. Location is great with good connections to Tegel with oublic transport - let's see when it closes. In addition the the Ku' is just around the corner for shopping, and U Bahn stations which enables you to get to most corners of Berlin quickly. Staff are efficient, and courteous, and recognize returning clients. Being in the hospitality industry myself, makes it difficult not be biased, but having stayed here so often and not been let down, there must be something to it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: truus
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! The location was perfect for us, we liked the swimmingpool and good sauna. It's much better than in most city hotels. The room was clean, modern and had great beds! It was a surprise to find a bath with above it a great shower. We had breakfast on the last day. It's not cheap but worth the money. We loved the pianobar and spent 3 nights there after dinner. On saterday there was live music and we saw a lot of Berliners sitting there as well. One night we had dinner, it was very good and it has a good pricerange, the waiter we had was competent and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: coolkenno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Got a great deal through booking.com. All the staff were very friendly. Rooms are very nice. Most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! Location is perfect. Very central. Spa facilities are really good fantastic sauna! Would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - but why the knocking?”
Reviews.Author: KiwiFreaks
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful hotel, roomy and stylish rooms, all very clean. But in the evening, there was a lot of knocking on the door. Twice a 'funny guy' - as he was gone after I checked. And three times 'room service' (?) knocking at 10pm at night... Weird. Luckily there was a peep hole to check who was there :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ArronRumsey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. The room was very nice. Service was very good, except for 1 small incident at breakfast with the waitress scooping what looked like some bread from the milk rather than giving us a new jug of milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: alpenbewohner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for the Berlin Marathon. They offer a package which includes breakfast starting at 5 on race day and a pasta dinner the night before, quality is excellent. Rooms are nice and clean. Those facing the courtyard are clearly the better choice as street facing rooms (a side street) can get a bit noisy on weekends. Location is great one block away from Kurfürstendamm, U-Bahn and S-Bahn are in easy reach so you are everywhere fast. Staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve16351
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on a city break to Berlin. I was happy with the location, which is situated right in the middle of one of the busiest and biggest shopping areas in Berlin. It is also well located with respect to the U-bahn, and tourism circuit in general. Always taxis available outside the hotel. The room was very modern and not lacking for space. It had also been recently refurbished. It was a little annoying that it was a smoking room as I had expressly reserved non-smoking, but none were available on check-in. However, it was not really noticeable in the room. The sound proofing seemed good, I could not really hear too much from other rooms, even when TV on it was very muffled. Party-go-ers outside in the square could be heard at night though. Large, double and very comfortable bed. Modern fittings in the bathroom and very clean. Reasonably priced bar and restaurant in the hotel (though the menu was not very extensive). I did not use the room service but the menu was extensive and some of it available 24hrs. Prices in the 15-25 EUR area for a meal+drink. If I had any niggles it was the service was not as good as it might have been sometimes, reception staff didn't seem that friendly and we seemed to get pestered quite a lot in the room from 09:00, 09:30, 10:00... (ok we laid in, it was a holiday!) for housekeeping, then maintenance we hadn't requested, turn down beds etc. We admittedly hadn't put a DnD sign out but it's never really been an issue for me anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in terms of value and location”
Reviews.Author: AnaZurich
Reviews.Content: Take advantage of the Spa area, after a long exhausting day just relax by the pool with a nice cold beer! Location wise, the hotel is perfectly situated. Plenty of restaurant around to go for dinner! The service and food in the hotel restaurant is really good and a drink on the piano bar is the perfect finish for a long day in a very interesting city! I loved it and will defenitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable behaviour”
Reviews.Author: Mslavina
Reviews.Content: I booked with them for three nights and warned them I would be arriving very late on Thursday night. When I arrived, they very coolly informed me that yes they know I made a reservation and availability was confirmed, but the room is not avaiable for this night. The front desk manager mentioned several time that it was the "house policy": apparently some guests from the conference or convention held there earlier in the week wanted to stay behind, I am to understand that it is their "policy" to let them at the expense of other people, or something very like it. He did not apologize, and only very unwillingly admitted that a mistake was made, but apparently it was justifiable because in accordance with the policy. When I asked why they hadn't contacted me (they had all my details on the reg form why ask for them if they don't use them for emergencies) he went on about the house policy. As to the practical side of things, they said I could stay that night at a hotel nearby (I think it was the Conrad) and come back the next morning. I could NOT stay three nights at that other hotel because they in turn did not have the availability (it was the weekend of the Germany-Turkey football game). That was obviously not acceptable, I asked if they tried to find me a place I could stay for the whole three nights, -- they did not. It was getting really, really late. I know I should've made a proper scene and called in a more senior person and after much talking maybe they would've found me a room to stay, e.g. by upgrading me if they had to. But being tired after the day at work and the trip, I just called the concierge at my bank and she swiftly found me a place to stay for the three nights -- the Hyatt. I regret that I let them get away with something as outrageous as this behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “We had the best wedding ever”
Reviews.Author: eliyah01
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our wedding in the Steigenberger Hotel in Berlin. I have to say, it was wonderful. We were no easy customers for multiple reasons: We wanted the ceremony to be outside (they have a wonderful gardened open space in front of the hotel), the food had to kosher and many other small things. They never ever gave us the feeling that this is too much or that we're asking crazy things. They made us feel safe with everything and gave us a wonderful room for the wedding night, decorated with rose leaves. We had about 120 guests and everybody was amazed about the whole event and how it was carried out. My wife and I want to thank the team at the Steigenberger Hotel for the great and personal yet professional service. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't quite live up to five star ratings.”
Reviews.Author: Cantstandbadhotels
Reviews.Content: It's adequate but not five star. I was disappointed with the room (small), bathroom (very small) and lack of king-sized beds. I think this is an upmarket, tour or convention hotel with a ho hum lobby and not enough service. I would look elsewhere in Berlin for the price we paid on expedia.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: nduk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times, both were equally consistent in terms of room and quality. The hotel is situated very close to Zoo Bahnhof, which makes it very easy to get to from Tegel by bus (20 minutes on the TXL) or Schönefeld by S-bahn. The hotel itself is a great 60's edifice on a leafy square, the rooms are modern clean and spacious & the staff are extrememely helpful with excellent English (My German is a bit rusty !) Both times I've stayed in a standard room, they've been big, clean, very well stocked (sewing kits, toiletries etc) with desk, coffee table and armchairs and very quiet. The complementary wifi is hassle free and very welcome! I'd like to mention the bathrooms in particular, they have very plush walk-in showers instead of baths - really nice ! Buses 100 & 200 leave from the nearby Breitscheidplatz & pass all of the main tourist sights so getting around is really easy. There are also a couple of excellent places to eat on Rankestrasse next to the hotel, check out the Imbiss near Breitscheidplatz for authentic Currywurst & a traditional German restuarant (sadly I can't remember the name, but it's easily spottable) where you can get Eisbein (pork knuckle). There's also a bakery on Rankestrasse & in Zoo station if you want to skip the hotel breakfast. All in all, a dependable hotel with excellent facilities, good location and no surprises !

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes BUT....”
Reviews.Author: 2plus8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a lovely peaceful location looking out on a little park yet just around the corner from bustling Kudamm and many high quality shops and loively restaurants and bars. Just beside the Kaiser Wilhem memorial church, The Zoo and the underground station. The hotel is located too far away from all the interesting sites in the East of the City so you must Bus Train or taxi. The rooms are good with tea/coffe facilities and a fridge. There is no bath - though a very good hot powerful shower and toiliteries. The one negative about the hotel is that is seems to cater for Business people (the wi fi area free of charge is a good plus though). The staff are not in the least bit warm friendly or welcoming not a smile visable the four days we stayed :( and that was my biggest negative and the lobby/reception mirrors their manner. Cold and unwelcoming .

Reviews.Title: “rebuilding right outside the room”
Reviews.Author: MariHel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for my birthday, and it was a good location and nice room, but there were so much work going on outside the room that it was quiet an let down. The top floor we lived on looked just like a construction-site and there were a crappy carpet but on the floor. As a compensation for the inconvenience we received two free drinks. The hotel personnel were polite but not very friendly and did not go to any length to make us feel welcome. The room, which was totally new was nice, but there were small details that I would have complaint about to the entrepreneur, like a large gap between the floor and the bathtub (this really did not look nice ;) ). The executive area was really nice and it was great with free wine and beer, and some snack in the evening. The breakfast in this area was small but enough to be content. I would recommend anyone considering this hotel to make sure that it is fully renovated before you come, so that you don't have to feel that you are disturbing someones working day!

Reviews.Title: “Great West Berlin location, beware of construction”
Reviews.Author: yapmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Jet lagged on the first morning and woke up to drilling and other construction noises. It was loud but not continuous. Found out that they were doing quite a bit of work with the rooms. The next few days, we woke up earlier and left before the noises started at 10am. Breakfast buffet expansive at 23 euro, instead go for room service. The charge is only 3 euro extra, and we spent 30 in total for 2. This is a good place for West Berlin. Good night life activities nearby. Need transport to see the sites in East Berlin. A/c works fine. No bath tub, shower was just fine.Good water pressure. Pool small but functional. convenience store to left, right and left of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff in a vibrant, inviting and comfortable environment.”
Reviews.Author: 09htown
Reviews.Content: Comfortable,quiet, modern rooms and amenities with a very helpful staff in a convenient location. A short walk from the Berliner Zoo transport center, easy access to shopping, public transit and a great variety of ethnic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel at very good price”
Reviews.Author: prindotto
Reviews.Content: I have been there for almost one week with my family. The hotel is located very conveniently close to the Zoo and close to Underground. The rooms were very clean and comfortable; the personnel was very professional. All in all, the price I was offered was very good with respect to the standard price of similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not upto scratch for a 4/5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah057
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned for the U and S Bahns to do all the city sightseeing you need. Also the open top buses stop just a 5min walk from the hotel. The rooms were adequate and very clean but the air conditioning was not efficient and so the rooms got very hot at night. Breakfast is served until 10.30 and is quite a spread, but get there early because at 10.30 they start clearing everything away. We took drinks one night on the terrace of the Piano bar, these were very expensive and the waitress nor reception seemed at all perturbed when we reported that a rat was running around the floor! Our visit would have been most pleasant if it were not for the response we had - I think they could at least have made a token gesture and taken something off the bill.

Reviews.Title: “We get much more than we have paid and expected.”
Reviews.Author: sigalit_10
Reviews.Content: The staff is very polite and tries very hard to help: at the front desk they help us for example as we arrived with our little girl who has slept very less until our journey to Germany and the gave us the room before the normal check-in time at 15h at 10h!! There was also a very nice lady who has helped us to find our way through Berlin to see all the sights. We have a very big room which was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast has much variety and taste. The swimming pool was nice and warm. We certainly will come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Summer_Traveller_hk
Reviews.Content: We stayed there fore 4 nights. Got a really good deal of EUR104 for an Executive room per night including the lounge access and additional bed for our son. The room is very clean and looks modern with LCD TV. WIFI is free. But the restaurant is not terrific (if you like American steak, try the Mid Town Grill in Marriott Potsdam). There are plenty of cafes and eating places around. The hotel is located off the main street and therefore very quiet, but only 1min walk from the main street, and 5 mins away from the main shopping area and KaDeWe. Good location. Berlin is a big city with over a hundred museums. You could easily spend 4 days only covering major tourist spots. Going on a hop-on/hop off bus is great to get an overview on where things are. If you happen to be there in summer, there are also evening organ concerts in the DOM which is really worth going due to good acoustic and ambience. The only tourist spot which requires some queuing would be the Bundestag (the parliament building). Make sure you have sun screen or umbrella during sunny days as the queue could get quite long. BTW, the hotel is very close to the Berlin zoo. Visiting the polar bear is a must, especially the feeding session which starts at 10:30am. We don't usually go to zoo but this one shouldn't be missed if you are in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
