Reviews.Author: sisli
Reviews.Content: Great location (busy shopping street Kudam and also a metro stop right next door), nice room, tropical rain shower was a nice touch, free internet in the lobby, very helpful & polite staff spoke fluent english, 5minutes walk to airport bus stop. Cleaning in neighbouring rooms started early and woke us up. All in all expect a bit more from a five star hotel - more like a four to four and a half star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable & well located hotel in West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CPFCeagles
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I enjoyed our stay here. We had a twin bedded room that was a good size with mini bar, shower ( no bath). Bed was firm and hotel blissfully quiet at night. Location was excellent with at least 4 underground stations close by and on different lines. The kaiser wilhelm church and main shopping area is just around the corner. We wanted a good safe base and this was ideal. Took about 15 mins to travel to the Brandenberg Gate fanzone for world cup screenings, the Reichstag and the art galleries up at potsdamer platz . Breakfast 23 euro so try and get an inclusive deal (amazing jams!) Sauna and pool looked ok but didnt have time to use. Loads of space to hang out in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Fishoutofwater66
Reviews.Content: i was very pleased with this hotel. I was not familiar with the area nor do I speak German. The front desk was friendly and accommodating. The rooms were nice and this hotel has a great location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more for the price, but watch out for naked pensioners in the sauna”
Reviews.Author: vingummi
Reviews.Content: It's probably more of a 4 star hotel than 5 star BUT all of the extras that you get (if you stay in the executive room) make it worth 5 stars: welcome chocolates, marble bathroom with bath, free comb and vanity set, fluffy bathrobe and slippers in room, free wifi, espresso machine in room, access to executive lounge with free breakfast, free softdrink during the day, free wine & beer at night, great location, pool and sauna. Staff were extremely friendly. My only complaint (and this is not the fault of the hotel at all) is that the clientele of the hotel (which seem pretty old) tend to strip off entirely to use the sauna, not a pretty sight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ebbie1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel near all the shops - perfect for the Berlin Marathon. Very professional like all the Steigenbergers and in a quiet side street.

Reviews.Title: “Steigenberger Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liene37
Reviews.Content: I loved the rooms, the location & also the hotel staff they were so kind.

Reviews.Title: “Meets 5-Star Criteria”
Reviews.Author: majordud
Reviews.Content: This is a real find.It''s located a block off Ku-dam in S-W Berlin -- near the Tiergarten and plenty of fancy shops and department stores. Check-in was excellent but, as others have noted, not cheery or particularly interested. The concierges, on the other hand, were outstanding, willing, and friendly. Our room was very clean and quiet (except for church bells on Sunday). We were on the executive floor which gave us access to its lounge. This was wonderful: a great continental breakfast, nice pastries and other goodies at tea-time, and wines, beer, soft-drinks and waters together with mixed cold-cuts, breads and soup as appetizers at the dinner hour. (All inclusive with the room price, which was $155 US a night.)There are two computers you can use(free) and a newspaper each morning. This hotel is a genuine bargain: everything worked, was clean and deluxe. My wife accessed the spa and had two outstanding massages..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Klemensito
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for us by our friend.Our room rate included breakfast consisting a various choices of cold and hot meals.The room was very comfortable, clean and hotel it self is good located in the heart of West Berlin,close to KaDeWe shopping center,underground station and K-Damm.Outside hotel entrance you can always take a cab and in our opinion is not expensive if you f.ex.want a ride to Museum Insel. The only minus must be a bit sleepy staff and deco reminding of a east european architecture(especially a dining hall).Unlike the rest of hotel, rooms and lobby are decorated in modern style.

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: blackeagle77
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and the hotel workers make you feel very welcomed. Everybody is helpful. On a less positive side is the fact that housekeeping staff comes too often. But you can place the "no disturb sign" on the door and enjoy your privacy. Will definitely recommend this hotel for its location in Berlin, service and charm.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough!”
Reviews.Author: RuxandraB
Reviews.Content: 5*? In their dreams! 3* for sure! When I saw mika_berry2009’s review, I asked my travel agent for details. She talked to the managing team and they explain that only 4th floor is a little renovating and there won’t be any construction works during our stay (mid April)! So we confirmed our reservation and took the plane! We arrived pretty late in the evening, tired after two flights. We took the bus TXL 109 Zoologischer Garten via Ku’dam from Tegel airport 5,40 eur/2 pers, aprox 15 min to Ku’dam (Erotic Museum), went back 200 mp on Joachim-something strasse then Augsburgerstrasse. The first morning, at 9:20, a drilling machine starts its concert!!! It seems in was right below my feet! They worked even on Saturday! They even check in people on 4th floor!!!!! The hotel is situated just behind Karstadt department store. We managed to avoid the bell capitain (thank you again, mika_berry2009!) and checked in quickly at 5th floor. About the room: basics, 1 bathrobe for 2 pers, occuerd smell from ventilation system, nice and modern bathroom, dust in the corners, plenty of sunlight though a large window, dirty walls, small holes in the curtain, incredible comfortable pillows, spartan amenities, old TVset (no flat TV or dvd player or coffee machine or news papers), CNN, Euronews, something in French, probably the best location for eating, shopping and exploring too, nice lobby, cold staff, decent breakfast (but 27 eur/pers is waaay too much), kind of wireless internet. After 2 nights we realized we should have upgrade the room, but we were afraid of changing the level of noise and the and view, considering the volcano eruption in Island, we weren’t sure of staying until the end of reservation. So, if you want a decent room, I think you should book a superior or executive room from the beginning. I think we had a standard room (even I didn`t see such a room on their website), because we didn`t have coffee/tea facility. Where to eat: Italian restaurant Vapiano on Augsburgerstrasse, German restaurant Ranke 2 on Rankestrasse.. The nearest U-bahn station is Augsburgerstrasse, near a mini-market open daily 7-22 (get out of the hotel, take left on Augsburgerstrasse, walk 100 -150 m). Or you can walk about 7-10 min on Ku’dam to Wittenbergplatz station. Anyway, despite the great location, probably won`t stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: annie_is_lovely
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel not knowing a huge amount about it, but after reading reviews on trip advisor was looking forward to my stay - and we weren't disappointed. the staff were extremely friendly on arrival. we booked our hotel on expedia and opted for the executive room which was almost certainly worth the extra!!! you get use of the lounge on the same floor as your room, which serves continental breakfast, aftertoon teas coffees and cakes and then at 5pm starts serving canapes and a choice of wine or berliner pilsner to help yourself to!!! the room itself was a great size with plently of space nicely furnished in a modern style and your own use of an espresso maker which was a nice change. all in all a great location very close to the tiergarten train station and a great hotel, highly recommended for anyone staying for a city break!!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reddobie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. One street off the Ku'dam. Set on a quiet street away from street noise. The hotel staff were very professional and nice. We never encountered one rude or curt person. The rooms are beautiful...flat screen TV with only two english channels, CNN/BBC..mini refrig filled, but can put your own drinks in as well...beds are okay, soft...hotel was full while we were there so it was a little noisy at night...bathroom was very nice, great rain head shower...closets and drawers for clothing...room safe which had to be repaired before using it...and broke again while there...plenty of room in move about...Nice hotel bar, which allowed dogs...great drinks...absolutely beautiful hotel in a fantastic location...we also heard some construction work one day, and called the desk...next day we had a tub of champagne and fruit with apologies...I think this hotel is a class act all the way...Spa area is really nice...unfortunately while there it was hard to enjoy the great pool as rude parents did not properly instruct children how to behave especially in the pool...pool is fairly warm...not a hot tub...but very comfortable and soothing....nice sauna...several showers...all coed, and a few people sans swimsuit in sauna...we had breakfast included in our price, so we enjoyed that each morning...typical great german breakfasts...also two computers in the lobby with free internet access..I rated this hotel 5 stars because of our great experience, the decor, the staff, the accomodations, and spa area...and its location...would definitely make an effort to come back to this hotel if in Berlin again...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfullllll!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mar_2903
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Steigenberger Berlin was just amazing. Everything was perfect from the room, the spa, the restaurant through the reception staff ... EVERYTHING is worthy of a 5 star! We stayed 3 nights during the Easter holidays and on Saturday evening when we arrived at the hotel we were pretty surprised to have a large chocolate Easter bunny laid on our bed (it was divine!) I therefore strongly recommend this hotel for its quality and its location in the city center 2 minutes walk from Kaiser Wilhelm Gedächtnis Church and transit, tourist buses and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not gettin' that extra star from ME!”
Reviews.Author: colonyantman
Reviews.Content: Great deal on Venere - couldn't resist. Incredibly quiet for where it is (right off the Ku - Damm). Room comfy. Nice pool. Professional, if curt staff. No complaints. No regrets. But 5 stars? I don't THINK so!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, horrible check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: mika_berry2009
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, but when we got there after a treacherous Ryanair trip from London we wanted a smooth check-in. The reception staff was extremely 'out of it', cold, aloor and almost rude. We asked him for a quiet room and he said yes he gave us a quiet room. There was a bell person who kept chatting and gesturing to the reception staff when he was checking us in, who was a bit of a nightmare. While we were asking the reception staff for a quiet room etc he kept winking at the reception staff and then wanted to chat with us. He asked us "so are you from Egypt?" and laughed. He seemed to be the one who was from Egypt and we just smiled and said no we were not from Egypt. He took my suitcase, and when he latched onto my suitcase he used his foot, kicking my suitcase to turn it around so that he could push it. Shocked by this but too tired to raise any issue we went into the elevator to go to the room where he kept taunting us saying "oh I'm from Tokyo! I'm from Tokyo" (I am obviously the one from Asia so he was mocking me? Not too sure). He took his tip and disappeared. We did tell the reception that we were not happy with the room and the way we were taunted in the elevator by the bell guy (who was old but I didn't think his age should give him the right to pick up a customer's ethnicity and joke about it. Especially when people are tired from a trip and just longing for some peace and quiet racial jokes tend not sound very funny, well, at least to me). Back to the aloof reception staff. He gave us a room right in the middle of full-blown , serious renovation work. The carpet in front of our room was taped over with grey sheets. We were too tired so we got into the room and spent an hour but found the smell and noise unbearable. We told the reception about the smell (chemicals?), construction noise and workers loud chatting outside the room, but he insisted that there shouldn't be any renovation work on the floor he checked us in. He reluctantly moved us to another floor. The room was pretty nice, clean and there's a Nespresso machine, which was a big plus for me. And the cleaning staff was very nice. There were plenty of restaurants around, and a big Karlstadt department store is right across the street. I would recommend this hotel for its location, just don't expect anything courteous from the reception staff (maybe they are nice to German speakers, I don't know). And be vigilant with the goofy bell guy, if you are too tired to shut him up he'd be a bit overbearing and rude.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located and clean VS service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: tartedemaca
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (early 20s) got a real bargain on this one via ebooking, otherwise we'd have booked other hotel instead. Anyways, its location alone is worth the booking. In addition to the excellent location: it's clean and comfortable plus the wi-fi (or the hotel's business center which is actually a small room with 2 computers - do you have a laptop or smartphone? good for you, use it). I'm not sure if the rooms are 5star-quality, but they're clean and cozy. If you're addicted to television make sure to bring some DVDs - german tv is garbage. The only stuff worth-watching was cnn and bbc world (or art if you speak German or French). Don't miss the restaurants on Rankestrasse and the italian coffee shop on the same street (on the other side of the road). For those who arrive at Tegel this is an excellent option (one bus will take you to the Zoo for 2 euros, then walk) and probably will be worth the money. We travelled during the Winter season (NYE actually) and the room (as well as the hotel as a whole) was fully heated so don't worry. There's a supermarket in the neighborhood. The recepetion staff is soulless. I don't know if this is a german thing or if it was due to our young age, but needs improvement. Well, at least they speak English unlike most of the germans. The working-cleaning staff, on the other hand, is very nice and will greet you with a smile every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Practical hotel in a practical city”
Reviews.Author: londoner-wannabe
Reviews.Content: No one goes to Berlin for the charm or the architecture; that was all destroyed during the war and rebuilt in a hurry afterwards, and, truth to tell, the former West Berlin is as dull and gray as the former East Berlin. (A solid week of clouds and drizzle did not help in this regard.) The Steigenberger Berlin is as well located as it is possible to be in this sprawling city, where there is no such thing as a truly central location. The rooms are of a good size, very comfortable and well-equipped. Nothing wrong with them, but nothing memorable either. The street at the side of the hotel has several cheap (for Berlin) Italian restaurants (often the best food in Berlin is Italian).

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable worth of money”
Reviews.Author: SwedenGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We have been all over the world, been to hundreds of good hotels but never got so much for our money. Excellent central location, free breakfast and afternoon tea, free internet in the room. And the room was quiet and wonderful. (We stayed in an Executive room). Steigenberger ought to be higher in the ranking!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, strongly recomend”
Reviews.Author: rovas
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and modern rooms. Excellent location with some great restaurants in the area. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet clean hotel. Brilliant service. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: becklambert
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from five nights staying at the Steigenberger Hotel. I could not find any fault with the hotel at all. It is a twenty minute taxi drive from Tegel airport, although you could take a bus. The hotel was very quiet despite being just off K'Dam and was just a 5 minute walk to Zoogartern station. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes around so I did not pay extra for the breakfast. I really liked the area, although it seemed more of the sites were in the East. There were fantastic shops along K'Dam and the bombed church, Helmut Newton museum (really good) and Zoo were within walking distance. It only takes 15 mins on the u-bahn (the s-bahn is not working at present) to get to the East part anyway. Bus 100 or 200 from Zoo will take you out to Alexanderplatz. The room was spacious, had wifi and clean - great bathroom. The swimming pool also looked nice although I did not have time to use it. The staff were all very helpful in providing directions and suggesting things to see. I found it a very professional hotel and would definitely return. I also loved Berlin, everyone was helpful, and I took some time off to go and see the sights. The remaining part of the wall at Bernauer Strauss is a definite must. I cannot recommend the hotel high enough, especially if like me you want a quiet relaxing hotel after a long day. I should also add as a single female I did not feel at all un-safe, in fact much safer in Berlin than I do in my hometown of London.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Stappers
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed in Berlin previously (At Alexanderplatz) and chose to go back as we love the city and had a great time when first there. We chose the hotel because there was a good deal on Expedia. We arrived at Schoenefeld and got the train to Zoologischer garten for only a few Euros each and took about half hour. Zoologishcher garten to the hotel is about 5 minutes walk at the most so I couldn’t recommend this more. Check-in at the hotel was quick and we got shown to the room that was hassle free. The rooms were excellent and furnished to a high standard. We couldn’t complain about anything in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was excellent and was upto the four star standard expected. We didn’t use any of the facilities at the hotel other than the office, with internet access that was free charge. They also have a free wireless internet connection. We looked in the spa that looked fantastic and had a huge Jacuzzi aswell as a sauna, steam room, loungers and some fitness equipment. This rarely seemed busy whenever we walked passed especially during the day when it was almost deserted. The staff were very helpful from reception to the cleaners and the concierge who were all very friendly and went out of their way to help on every occasion. The Kurfurstendamm area was perfect to stay in with its shops and has plenty of restaurants and bars very close that are reasonably priced. Berlin is cheaper than you would pay in South East England, about €3 for a decent beer in a bar and around €7 for a pizza on Kufurstendamm. KaDeWe is only five minutes away and is a must for a visit just for its food hall. The standard of public transport in Berlin is superb and the connections from this area are excellent. From the station you can catch a train to the central station (for Brandenburg and Reichstag) or Alexanderplatz (For the TV tower) and the various buses and subways are excellent to all parts of the city. All the city bus tours stop in Kurferstendamm aswell so is very easy to get one aswell as using it to get around the city. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and is the perfect combination of an ideal location aswell as being a high-class hotel. Having stayed in Berlin previously this was an ideal part of Berlin to stay and the hotel was a fantastic standard and well above that expected for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Conferences”
Reviews.Author: ansjohnson7
Reviews.Content: This has an excellent mixture for conference hotel. I spent the weekend there for a alumni winter ball in January 2009 and was very impressed with decor and service. There are was a great fitness, sauna and swimming pool area. There are even fresh bathrobes that you could use there. I spent 2-3 hours working out and then relaxing there. The rooms are adequate. I was suprised that my room only had a shower. The food at the conference was great and the service during the alumni dinner was spectacular. The location near the Kuffursterdam places directly in one of the most lively sections of Berlin. The Train Station Zoologischer Garten is not from the hotel. I woud rccommend this hotel for a conference location or even short sightseeing tour of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and service exceptional, in a very good hotel - strong recommendation.”
Reviews.Author: george57l
Reviews.Content: Went for 2 day business trip with colleagues. Needed to book a conference room in hotel when we got there, and we were given one straight away at surprisingly reasonable rate. Worked through the evening and got excellent drinks and meal service brought to our conference room by very friendly waiter - again at short notice and no long delay for food and drink to arrive. Also - note this hotel has free WiFi - at last (!) a hotel in the 21st century and not trying to rip guests off for basic utilities in this day and age. I was taken ill on day two and eventually had to return to my room and stay there after official check-out time - staff were very accomodating, but eventually I had to ask them to call an ambulance to go to hospital - complete with luggage. All hotel staff very helpful indeed throughout. Several days later after my return home I needed to get some local errands completed in Berlin (small gifts, and translated written message to local hospital) and with no other place to turn to I telephoned to ask the Front Office manager how I could get assistance for these tasks locally in Berlin. She volunteered to get everything taken care of herself and it was all done just as requested and very quickly. Fantastic - service way beyond expectation. The hotel itself is well situated in a quiet square just behind Ku'damm close to Memorial Church so is very conveniently central. My room was spacious, comfortable and clean, with very comfortable bed. What more can be asked for? Breakfast buffet was very good with excellent and wide seleciton, with cook-to-order breakfast readily available. All in all a very polished, professional and guest-focused experience. Definitely a strong recommendation and if I return to Berlin will certainly try to stay there again if I can. (For anyone who is interested, the hotel also has a dedicated - and what looks like a very pleasant - cigar lounge between the reception and the restaurant, and an indoor 'normal' smoker's room!)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable 4*, but soul-less”
Reviews.Author: PontySpur
Reviews.Content: We would agree with some earlier views that this is a 4* rather than a 5* hotel. It's a quiet, convenient base for the western half of Berlin, for Ku-Damm shopping, and links to other areas of the city. The somewhat Stalinist exterior gives way to a roomy foyer, although a few more chairs there would be useful. Pleasant, helfpul staff and efficient check-in. Immediate setback in that during our stay, the pool was closed for repair. We had a comfortable double room on the 2nd floor which was functional rather than luxurious, with some dated features, eg TV, and no tea/coffee-making facilities. The minibar was expensive! The smallish bathroom was neat, but annoyingly the (glass) door wouldn't close properly. Our deal did not include breakfast which was priced at 23 euros! Several bars and restaurants located nearby offered good value meals and drinks. The piano bar appeared to be frequented by business expense account types, rather than routine vacationers, but perhaps the price list explained why! There wasn't much of an atmosphere there, and the hotel restaurant and bars appeared very quiet during our visit. Nevertheless, the hotel is spotlessly clean, and because of its convenient location, we would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2009 in Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: harryo2b
Reviews.Content: Alright so another 4+ Star hotel in the books and I must say this doesn't compare to others I've stayed in that are equal or higher in star category. I ended up choosing this hotel for a couple reasons. First, I was short on time and availability for avail rooms for New Years Eve in Berlin. Second, location was key in my decision as i wanted easy access to public transportation, a friendly neighborhood for the wife to walk the dog, shopping, food both the fast and the sit in variants and enclosed parking for the car. Last I was using previous customer reviews to help sway my decision. Now the hotel for the price was only okay. As mentioned in previous reviews there may have been a renovation or something at one point as the lobby and entry into the hotel was magnificent but when we entered our room it seemed like the forgotten one...actually the forgotten floor or more specific one of the non smoker floors. Maybe this is just Steigenberger quality or Berlin flare but the room didn't really meet my expectations of a 5 star hotel of such a prestigious European chain. Wood cabinetry seemed dated, tv was antiquated (still don't get why not just use LCD screens at places like this) and the bed was actually the Euro standard of two separate beds put together to form "one". Surely they would just have one piece queen/king mattresses, no? The best part of the room for me was the bathroom. Seemed as if it actually got the makeover. Nice granite countertops with dual sinks for me and the lady and a nice deep bath/shower. Also of note is that this hotel does allow dogs at the rate of 15 Euro a night, which is fine with us because we love travelling with our 7 month old Boston Terrier. Overall i rate this as only a decent hotel as far as specific facilites go to match star rating. When it comes to location and access it's near the top as it puts you smack dab in the center of the main shopping boulevard and a quick step to the U/S Bahns and even the bus station (local hub at Zoological Gardens). Oh and free Wi-Fi, you just have to ask for the key otherwise you will never know.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Experiance”
Reviews.Author: jcjimc
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin on a three day trip Sunday through Tuesday at the end of October 2008 and stayed at the Steigenberger Berlin. We drove to Berling arriving early on the Sunday morning at 10.30am after parking our car in the hotels underground parking facility we took the elevator to the reception area and our Steigenberger experiance began. The staff on reception were so helpful and we were allocated our room immeadiately as normally one has to wait at such an early time in the day. The location is in the heart of the city and within walking distance of many tourist attractions as well as easy access to the underground train system. On the first evening we ate in the hotel restuarant and although not busy provided excellent food and service. Now breakfast in this hotel is something else with a choice to be envied by its competitors. We thourghly enjoyed our stay at the Steigenberger and would recommend it to anyone who wishes a memorable stay in Berlin. We just wished we had had a longer time to stay as this hotel has lovely spa facilities which we wished we had time to use.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: midway42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for seven nights. This is a very good hotel with all the usual amenities of a four star stay-over. I also got an excellent rate (<200$/night) on the internet so the value was great as well. The Berliner Stuber has tasty regional food. Perfect location to explore the western half of the city. Clean rooms, above average service.

Reviews.Title: “What a breakfast !”
Reviews.Author: NorthWalesMillie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fortnight in Berlin staying at the Steigenberger.Lovely hotel.well appointed,wonderful breakfast buffet.Staff marvelous and very patient with my bad German though reception staff and many others spoke good English.Room very comfortable with climate control.Well placed for getting around the city. Especially good for shopping on the Kurfustendamm...bring an extra bag!! loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Don't bother reading the other reviews, as this hotel is as good as it gets for the price. It is a 4/5 star hotel and has all the services you need. This was my third stay and it is great value for money and a great city centre location for tourists. I was at a conference in the hotel and the conference facilities are some of the best in Europe. The only negative thing is the outside look of the hotel which is very 1960s, but inside it is great and the rooms are not large, but quite adequate. Taxi from the Tegel airport is less than 20 Euros.... On this stay I was upgraded to the Exec floor, with lounge facilites available until 9pm, inc Champagne..... Don't bother looking anywhere else.....stay here!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nisirian
Reviews.Content: Central location for tourists & within easy walking distanceof the railway station & shopping malls. Room was perfect Pool & Spa was perfect Breakfast was the best ever & HUGE!! Wonderful Staff Great Piano bar & cocktails Will Be Back.!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “book somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: torontotoronto75
Reviews.Content: unfortunately this hotel is extremely disappointing. the hotel has had a facelift, but the workings underneath are old. for instance, my door didn't even close properly - but after requesting to change rooms i found out none of them do! all the doors are warped but instead they spent their renovation money on new bedspreads. it was a sign i should have checked out immediately - at one point there wasn't even hot water in the hotel for over an hour. staff were less than helpful. meanwhile the lovely modern shower fixtures fell off the wall every single morning while i took my (occasionally cold) shower. if you're looking for a high end hotel i suggest you go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Personality Conflict: 3 Star trying to Be 4 Star, Classic Trying to Be Modern.”
Reviews.Author: Montylicious
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to enjoying a weekend getaway to Berlin and decided to choose a nicer hotel. After reviewing several options we chose the Steigenberger based on the hotels classic reputation. We had reserved the Executive Rooms which offered breakfast, a high floor hotel room, free coctails and a king size bed. This was all confirmed but when we went to the room we found we were in a two double bed room. And let me stress the double beds were each smaller than a full size bed. We returned to the front desk to get the room we requested which was 1 king size bed. We had the distinct impression there was a bit of homophobia based on the questioning look of the older clerk who obviously had an issue with this request. Nevetheless we received the room only to find out a King size bed at this hotel is really only a queen size bed. The room was clean but dated with tan walls, typical artwork and an outdated television. However the bathroom was quite nice and modern with marble and glass and high pressure spray. Like many modern hotels here the glass door to the shower covers only half of the tub and therefore water sprays on the floor when in use because the tub is not large enough to offer this option. Upon our return later that night we were promptly given the extra towels and ice we requested. The hotel bartender was extremely good serving dirty martini's perfectly and even offering me a full glass of olives when I asked for extras. Our six or seven drinks totaled over $100 USD but the service and quality was very good. They provided live music with a singer at the piano which was nice however she played with some electrical system that included light drums and threw off the quality of a piano bar. She also sang old basics like Rain Drops Keep Falling On My Head which was pretty dated. While there we checked out the Marriott near Postdamer Platz and I have to say it will be our next choice. Overall the hotel suffered from being once a very nice classic hotel striving for modern and the facilities just do not work.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star... Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KatPrints
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a 5 star. (as Expedia rate it) On the luxury front it barley scrapes a 4 star. The rooms are outdated, tired and in need of renovation. That said it is fantastically located; in easy reach of most of the sights, just off Berlin’s main shopping streets, 2 minutes from 2 different underground stations and 10 minutes from the train and bus terminal. It is close some very nice (if tourist-y) restaurants and bars. It is value for money (if mis-starred and therefore mis-sold) Points to note: *The pool is tiny and cold (in winter). *"Still" water is in fact sparkling. *Service is friendly but relaxed, definitely not what Americans would expect, no bell boy, flourish etc. *House keeping will knock at 9am unless you use the 'do not disturb sign', we stayed 6 days and the sheets were not changed (we knew this as there was a hole in our duvet cover) *Breakfast is expensive, but huge and cover all European preference from English bacon and eggs, to exotic fruit. *Opt for the Executive rooms, they have a free bar area, which can mean a considerable saving when a bottle of water in the mini bar in €5

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Vonsie
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on this hotel with e-bookers.ie which meant that the rather expensive breakfast was included in our rate. Overall I was disappointed with this hotel and it was not the 5 star hotel I would have expected for the Steigenberger chain. As there were three of us we knew one of us was going to get the short straw with an extra bed but the bed we got was terrible. It was lumpy and creaked, and wouldn't have been out of place in a fairly poor hostel. The decor in the room was also fairly dated in comparison to one of the other rooms which we saw. The location of the hotel was good, 2 mins from Kufurstendamm but if I was going back I wouldn't pick this hotel. A fantastic breakfast was a strong redeeming factor but overall it was quite dated and not 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 1doyler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on a lads weekend. Could not have been better value, great facilities, good rooms, cool piano bar, good location, nice staff. Couldn't think up a complaint if I tried. Really liked the pool and sauna / steam room as they were clean and usually empty. Also, it's nice to be able to sit by the pool and order a beer from the bar there. Piano bar is seriously cool and they had a fairly talented guy playing and singing there one night, he was very entertaining and played requests. Staff are very courteous and helpful. I can't fault this hotel, I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: GraceDublin
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a very central hotel in west berlin, close to all the hot spots - shopping, sight-seeing, cafés, restaurants, bars, etc - then the Steigenberger Hotel is for you! Having read some rave reviews and even some rare mediocre ones, I booked the hotel and on arriving I quickly realised that I made the right decision! The hotel is very central and yet is located in its own oasis of calm, as it faces onto a parkland! It was our first time in Berlin, and my sister and I spent a great weekend (Sat-Tues) in this truly amazing city, and would definitely return. In fact, four days is too short....there's so much to see and do. I had emailed the hotel in advance to enquire about early check-in, as our flight from Dublin was an early one, and staff could not have been more helpful and facilitated us as much as possible. We got a good deal on ebookers for the three-night stay, which included breakfast - the hot and cold breakfast buffet offers more than a substantial start to every day! The hotel is within easy walking distance of both U and S-bahn stations, and also is on the doorstep of all major sightseeing tour stops. After a long day sightseeing, the hotel is a welcome respite to relax and unwind in either main bar or piano bar or terrace before heading back out to sample the varied range of restaurants and nightlife that Berlin has to offer. The hotel has its own restaurant but as a minor downside, it seemed to lack any atmosphere, so we opted for the great choice of local bistros and restaurants nearby. Berlin.....we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: oso70
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Big room Really good bathroom Great location Fantastic breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: squasher
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at the hotel for four nights from the 3rd to the 7th May 2007. We booked a double room on the executive floor and would have to agree that it represented excellent value for money. To confirm what one or two of the earlier writers have said. The room includes use of the executive loungs that supplies a small buffet breakfast and then afternoon tea. I would recommend this hotel as being value for money in this price range and compares very well with similar hotels that enjoy a five star rating. G and C James South Wales UK

Reviews.Title: “Good for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: hiki
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I visited Berlin for a long weekend and chose the Steigenberger, because it offered a good deal for three nights. The price for the room was alright, the price - not included - for breakfast was too steep with 22,- Euro per person. I expect that a lot of other guests had another price, because the restaurant was more than crowded at breakfast time. The room was clean, large enough and we were given help with the Internet access. The twin beds are wider than normal, which was very welcome. It was nice and quiet in this room, as we were looking out onto the inner court - if you want to call it that. two or three straggling trees on a stony floor. There is a lot of potential for improvement here. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. We were able to buy tickets forpublic transport there as well. The zoo, the Kaiser-Wilhelm Gedächtniskirche, and the KaDeWe are all easy to reach, but I still prefer staying somewhere in Mitte instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tricky70
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here over New Year for 3 nights and it is one of the best hotels we have stopped in. The service and attention to detail is amazing. If you get the chance, book an executive room as this gives you access to the exec lounge where there is a complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea, and cocktails and canapes in the evening. It was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for deco but 2 Stars for Service”
Reviews.Author: gwright
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room and found that we had been allocated a smoking room of very inferior quality but managed to change to a vastly superior room the next day by the skin of our teeth. That evening we reserved a table for the Fish Buffet for 8pm. Arrived at 8 promptly. We eventually managed to be shown to our table and ordered wine but only afterwards to discover all the food had gone - nothing left except the dregs! The waiter seemed not too bothered. I questioned him why he had taken our wine order surely knowing full well there was no food left. He seemed less than apologetic and asked for payment for the wine! I complained at reception and we were offered free cocktails. On the day of our return, with time on our hands, we decided to take the train to the airport and were advised by the bell captain to go via Bundes Platz to Schoenefeld. Taking his advice was a big mistake - there are no trains to Schoenefeld via Bundes Platz on a Sunday. This hotel is badly in need of a manager who knows what is going on in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Steigenberger”
Reviews.Author: mogs32
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from Berlin after spending three nights at the Steigenberger. This is a great location from which to explore the city. The hotel itself is in cosmopolitan west Berlin, back-to-back with Ku'damm and two minutes walk from KaDeWe. Less than five minutes walk in the opposite direction is Zoo Station with links to all the main sites of east Berlin. Museum Island is about 10 minutes train ride followed by a short walk away. The Steigenberger is a good 4-star hotel, with comfortable rooms and friendly, professional staff you would expect at a hotel of this standard. However, we took the tip of another contributor to Trip Advisor and booked an Executive Room and we would highly recommend this to anyone thinking of staying here. All Executive Rooms are on the top floor and you have to insert your key-card in the lift to be able to access the floor. We would say the rooms are not especially superior, but access to the Executive Lounge makes the difference. Complimentary breakfast is served here until 11 (don't worry if you book "room only", you will still get breakfast), high tea is available 3 till 5 (tea, coffee, cakes, etc) and drinks and "nibbles" between 5 and 9, including endless supplies of beers, wine and champagne. All of this is complimentary and provided with first class service in the comfort of a very tranquil lounge. The evening champagne is lovely after a day's site seeing and before getting ready for the trip to the restaurant. Talking of which, if you're looking for something special we had an excellent meal at Borchardt [--] - take the u-bahn from Zoo to Stadmitte. One more thing, check out "Original Berlin Walks" for their "Discover Berlin" tour - an excellent way of getting an overview of the city. We also did the Sachenhausen Tour. We booked ours when we we booked the hotel via Expedia (best rates). We also bought a three day "Welcome Card" giving all travel in the city and discounts on museums, etc. Good value. I could go on and on. Great city; three days isn't enough. Send me a mail if you want to know any more.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: Machers
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter and I stayed here from the 12th to 15th Feb 07. The Hotel is in a great location particularly if you like shopping. It is on the main city bus tour route which you should try. The breakfast was first class with a hot and cold buffet available. The staff, particularly the Bell Captain were very friendly and helpful, they also spoke first class English. I would recommend the cocktail bar for great cocktails and the ambience. The rooms were well appointed and clean. If I had one complaint it was that I booked a triple room and got a double with a fold down bed put in against the wall. It was a comfortable bed but I was disapointed given everything else was perfect. The bathroom had no bath only a shower, which I prefer, it was decorated to a very high standard and was well supplied with shower gels etc. Some people often complain about hard pillows, it's probably subjective but I found these pillows very comfortable and smelt of fresh linen. I would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent”
Reviews.Author: thebride57
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three-day break at this hotel. Loved everything about it. Taxi from Schoenefeld 30 euro. Hotel was very nice we got a really good deal £312 for 3 people x 3 nights B&B. The breakfast was excellent everything you would could want. The Bathroom was Luxurious; toiletries were very like Molton Brown only with a different name. Staff very helpful. The room was exactly as it was on the web page. Pillows excellent (i say this because everyone seems to have a comment about pillows in all the hotels) location was brilliant just around the corner from the K'damm. (not the expensive end). Shopping OK all the shops are all UK shops. Try the shopping centre at Potsdamer Platz loads of food outlets and tons of shops.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smick
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. We were upgraded to a superior room. It was average in size but had a massive bed, large luxurious bathroom, large LCD TV with loads of stations and nice furniture around the room. The hotel is within walking distance of Zoo train station. There are other U-bahn stations nearer such as Kudamm and Augsbergerstr. but it is easier to walk from Zoo. The minibar does not have sensors, meaning we could take out their expensive products and put our store bought drinks and snacks in there and not be charged for it. We paid £170 stg for 2 nights stay. Negatives were the view from the room and the fact that on checking in, there was a large queue and the staff seemed unable to cope. One person blatantly skipped the queue and nothing was done about it by the staff. But I would recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, worth every cent we paid for it.”
Reviews.Author: Teacher95
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just a few steps from Breitschield Platz, underground stations, department stores and Ku'damm, a beautiful avenue. Moreover, we booked an executive room which included free access to executive club with free food and drink from 7.00 to 13.00 and from 15.00 to 21.00. we had Moet and salmon every evening!!! My 6 year old son loved the facilities too. The staff were friendly and helpful, there were many takis in front of the hotel, swimming pool is delicious, all in all, a very good hotel. If we come back to Berlin I will definitely book Steigenberger again!

Reviews.Title: “Pure pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Gitte11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel where we got totally spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: orits
Reviews.Content: What an amazing location!!! Couldn't pick a better hotel!!! True! No one in Berlin knows where the hotel OR the street is. The price we have paid ( hotels.com) was £ 57. Beat that!!! Shame there was no breakfast to go with this great price, but there are so many places to eat, we hardly gave it a second thought. Best location for shopping!!! Take right after leaving the hotel, and follow the main road until you get to one of the biggest department stores in Germany! Ka De We. go to the 6th floor and see all the amazing food!!! Increadable. Loved it so much. will book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “What 5-star?”
Reviews.Author: sydspot
Reviews.Content: I booked online and got a great rate. Upon check-in, I was shocked at the room we received -- very stripped-down. It was like a 3-star hotel -- of the Quality Inn level. No amenities at all...there was one pump in the shower that was a body and/or shampoo. The towels were so thin and coarse. I was really shocked, and a bit disgusted. I asked to see the manager and she was polite was but did not acknowledge the problem until I became very specific about what I expect from a 5-star and what I am receiving. With a bit of insistence, she moved us into a 4+-star room. Here there were individual amenities, albeit cheap ones -- not luxurious by any means, robes, and the room just seemed genenally cleaner and brighter. I agree with another reviewer, that they have rooms for those that book a "cheap rate" and other rooms for those that pay the rack rate. At any rate, I have no idea how they can call themselves 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “A good Choice”
Reviews.Author: indigogirl1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here whilst on a short city break in Berlin. If you are going to berlin for shopping this is the best location for you. It is one block from the main shopping strip and is surrounded by lots of nice places to eat and drink. If you are going to Berlin for the history...the berlin wall and nazi stuff then I would recommend staying in the East. We had to travel to the other side of the city but this was not too big a problem as the transportation is excellent. The hotel room was big and airy but the reason I gave it a 4 out of 5 is that the hotel tended to slap on extras to everything. it was extra to watch TV in your room and extra to use the hotel swimming pool or sauna...in saying that...these were not too expensive to add...but its the principle of the thing...a good hotel should not charge extras. One word of warning...keep your door locked as housekeeping tend to ignore do not disturb signs and like to walk in on you! All in all this was a good hotel and is reccomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation for the Berlin Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Begsie
Reviews.Content: Hi my wife and I booked this hotel as I was running in the Berlin Marathon. The location was excellent close to the shops and nightlife in the Ku Damm area but situated in a quiet side street. This meant we could have a quiet meal and drinks outside the hotel at the chairs and tables provided during the warm September evenings we experienced. The hotel had a pasta party for marathon runners and their friends the night before the race. On the morning of the race the hotel opened their restaurant for breakfast early from 6am to facilitate marathon runners. This was well appreciated although I was not able to make full use of the excellent fare on offer as I had to run 26.2 miles a short time later. I did make up for this on the following two mornings sampling both the cold and hot breakfasts together with the wide selection of breads and pastries. A friend of mine stayed at the Intercontinental and their restaurant did not oblige with an early opening and he had to grab two bananas for breakfast at the first water/food station on the marathon route. I found the hotel facilities to be first class although i did not experience the pool or sauna, maybe next time. One small detail missing was the absence of a tea/coffee maker in our room which would have provided a welcoming cup of coffee first thing in the morning. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful. The reception staff handled the mailing of a letter and also forwarded on a camera case that I had inadvertantly left behind in my room. My thanks is also directed to the housemaid who recovered the case from the bottom of a wardrobe. A previous reviewer complained about the maid's haste in trying to clean their rooms. I did not find this to be a problem although the maid called I simply requested that she return later. This was no problem, maybe I should have just put out a do not disturb sign until we were ready to have our room cleaned. An excellent hotel with a very convenient location to shops/restaurants and transport. My wife and I are looking forward to our next vist to Berlin and the Steigenberger.

Reviews.Title: “A nice splurge”
Reviews.Author: CHT
Reviews.Content: With an online reduced rate (150E), my wife and I thought we would try at least one "luxury-type" hotel on the trip. Besides, Berlin was proving a little difficult to book a hotel in. For the most part, the Steigenberger lived up to expectations. The pool was especially nice after a day of non-stop walking, and the room was larger and more "American" than we were used to. The staff was professional and helpful, although I'm not sure that we were their "normal" clientele. The only negative was the directions (on line) from the train station to the hotel. This was the only hotel (out of 13 on our trip) for which the directions were inadequate. The online map is missing street names and implies that the hotel sits alone behind the Europa Center. And, believe me, nobody in Berlin knows where "Los Angeles Platz" is!! It took us an hour of trekking around the area with our suitcases before another hotel's conceirge gave us a map and drew the directions. All in all, the hotel was fine, but I'll probably look around for another next time I visit Berlin. The location was pretty good, with a five minute walk to KuDamm and a 12-15 minute walk to the train station, but, with a city this large, I would want to be a little closer to mass transit that this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “Less of the attitute, gals”
Reviews.Author: AideenJennings
Reviews.Content: Last two days in Germany so decided to push the boat out and book the *****, got a good price and most importantly the promise of a kingsize bed. Upon arrival, checked in went up to the room and was very dissappointed. The room was a bit shabby, several cracked tiles in the bathroom and the bed was not kingsize. There was the space for a kingsize bed alright, but two single mattresses had been pushed in and there was a gap between the bedside table and the mattress!! I went down to the reception and gingerly approached the subject of the bed size. There was about 5 Gastapo power dressed receptionists manning the desk at the time, most seemed a bit scary!. Was it because they thought I had got the room too cheap?, it seemed a bit like that to me. Anyway they sent me off to look at another room which was equally as poor. Back down I went and when I produced my bit of paper that clearly said kingsize bed, they gave me the keys of a decent room. Their attitude was shockingly bad and I truly believe they were judging me on my appearance (regular - holiday mode, not powered up though!) and also that I had booked a cheapie.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, this is a lovely hotel. However.....................”
Reviews.Author: Marcia.1950
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. However, the maids burst into our room twice on the day we were checking out. The first time before 8:00 a.m., and the second around 9:00 a.m. Upon reporting this to the reception on checking out, the clerk looked at me and said "what is your problem?" This is a five star property! The maids shouldn't be anywhere near that room until we have cleared check-out. No manners, and I can't recommend this hotel as a great five-star.

Reviews.Title: “great position lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobyBucks
Reviews.Content: Really nice clean hotel, service in the restraunt could of been better it startef off well but then we were forgot about. Great position.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for West Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Petmar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in West Berlin and only a 3 minute walk to Zoo station and KaDeWe. It overlooks the quiet and pretty Los Angeles Platz. The hotel is quite large and a little sterile, but is very well kept. It caters primarily to business travelers, therefore good deals are available for the weekend, but extras such as breakfast (€22) are rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mcphisto
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Stayed here two nights before heading out to the suburbs in Berlin for a conference. Was thrilled with the location and the service. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were big enough, but maybe not five-star in terms of decor and facilities. However, the servicing of the rooms was definitely five-star. The pool was a little small, so, don't expect to be getting your olympic training in, but the sauna was excellent with a nice plunge-pool. They provide plenty of towels, robes and slippers. It is more of a relaxation area than an exercise area. The food in the restaurant was quite good, and the piano bar was very relaxing, if a little pricey. We found this a good base for exploring Berlin city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel :) :) :) !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from Berlin. Our stay at the Steigenberger Berlin was one of the best hotel experiences that my husband and I have ever had. The hotel is so beautiful. The picture online doesn't do it justice. It is in a great location to almost anything that you could want to do in Berlin. The U- Bahn and S- bahn are nearby and so are all the buses. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast buffet devine!! I am missing that this morning!! Our room was so nice. A queen sized bed with down comforters and a really nice bathroom with a great shower and a heated bathtub. The big plus is that the windows open in the rooms so you can get fresh air. The swimming pool is beautiful and I went in the sauna for the 1st time in my life. We give the Steingenberger an A+ and recommend it to everyone and anyone looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the extra?”
Reviews.Author: RUNRIG
Reviews.Content: The executive accomodation on the top floor is fantastic and worth the extra. The attention to detail is super. Free Moet and branded spirits on tap, what more could you ask for! Highly recommened.
